Board Game Soundtracks

Welcome! This is my collection of board game soundtracks. Each playlist is manually curated to provide the best possible atmosphere for your gaming session. If you have a request for a game you can contact me at @tobiasthorin.bsky.social.

  • Azul

    Medieval music from Portugal and Spain, including many authentic period works. A feeling of warm climate and sophistication.

  • Boss Monster

    Chiptunes version of classic pop and rock songs. Upbeat and nerdy!

  • Calico

    Cozy and chill, like the warm nuzzle of a gently purring kitten come to rest.

  • Captain Sonar

    Hectic and unnerving. A constant reminder of your imminent claustrophobic demise, a countdown to the cold abyss!

  • Carcassonne

    French medieval music played by modern artists. A stroll through the historic countryside with the sun at your back.

  • Drakborgen

    Eerie athmopheric soundscapes and spooky noises. Dank dungeouns, dark corridors, and a lurking dragon at the heart of the fortress!

  • Gloom

    Melancholy instrumentals and classic peieces. Music for a funeral, for a tragedy, for a beautiful parlor, with nothing but sad memories in it.

  • Heat: Pedal to the Metal

    High energy classic rock and video game tracks. Adrenaline pumping, high octance, full throttle racing music - push your car to the limit!

  • The Hunger

    Bombastic classical compositions. Dark but grand, the tragedy of eternal life. The means to live like a king while being forced to hide in the shadows of the night.

  • Sheriff of Nottingham

    Fantasy medieval tunes. The bustling of a spring market or the dance in a crowded tavern. Let the money flow, the ale be drunk, and the sheriff be fooled!

  • Thebes

    Historic folk music from Greece, Egypt and Mesopotamia. A sense of mystery and exotic discovery. A delve into history itself.

  • Ticket to Ride: Göteborg

    Songs about Gothenburg. Humorous tunes, love letters, and a general celebration of the finest city in Sweden. Check your ticket and board the tram!
